name: Special Topics in Migration and Public Health
description: The focus of this seminar is on public health as an institution and on the contemporary and historical practices related to migrants in Canada and globally. Practices include surveillance, screening, detention, and quarantine, among other forms of governance and regulation. Societal issues, social theory, and historic case studies drawn from literature, film and empirical research explore enduring questions and tensions related to the treatment of migrants by public health systems.
prerequisites: [[HLTB16H3 and HLTC05H3] and [1.5 credits at the C-level in HLT courses] and [a minimum CGPA of 2.5]] or [SOCB60H3 and an additional 15.0 credits]
